review: I first visited Centella Bistro for lunch the day I arrived in Negombo and had what turned out to be one of the best fish curries I had during my three weeks in Sri Lanka.  It was so good that I made sure to return...for dinner when I was back in Negombo before flying home.  On that occasion I had the fish cutlets for entree followed by the chicken curry. The accompanying dhal, beetroot & pumpkin sides were also delicious.  The food is cooked fresh to order, including spice levels. The service is also friendly and attentive.  Highly recommend for dinner when I was back in Negombo before flying home.  On that occasion I had the fish cutlets for entree followed by the chicken curry. The accompanying dhal, beetroot & pumpkin sides were also delicious.  The food is cooked fresh to order, including spice levels. The service is also friendly and attentive.  Highly recommended.
Very nice food in a very fine atmosphere. Cooking is done with love and attention. And that you can taste. Just go there and enjoy!

I enjoyed a delicious fish curry here last night. Loved all the side dishes. A cold Lion Lager was the perfect accompaniment. 

Service here is warm and friendly. The restaurant is close to the hustle and bustle of Negombo Beach but offers a peaceful setting...in which to enjoy your meal. 

I’ll definitely be returning here before I leave Negombo. Highly recommend in which to enjoy your meal. 

I’ll definitely be returning here before I leave Negombo. Highly recommended.

If you’re staying in Negombo, don’t miss out on this amazing gem restaurant! All dishes are very high quality traditional Sri Lankan, absolutely fresh and local. We tried different starters and curries as well as the amazing coconut and cheese cake. I am surprised this...place is not packed all the time. Maybe it’s because it’s located at one of the main roads in Negombo but don‘t let this mislead you. Everything is home made (they even make their own curry mix and hang their chilis out to dry). The owner is a great, inspiring dude who lived and worked at 5 star hotels in the UK - you can really feel the love of traditional Sri Lankan food meeting 5 star hotel cuisine. Next time we‘ll be in Sri Lanka, the Centella Bistro is definitely on the li place is not packed all the time. Maybe it’s because it’s located at one of the main roads in Negombo but don‘t let this mislead you. Everything is home made (they even make their own curry mix and hang their chilis out to dry). The owner is a great, inspiring dude who lived and worked at 5 star hotels in the UK - you can really feel the love of traditional Sri Lankan food meeting 5 star hotel cuisine. Next time we‘ll be in Sri Lanka, the Centella Bistro is definitely on the list!
This restaurent has the most delicious rice and curry. We have eaten rice and curry everywhere in Sri Lanka, but like Cencela it is a curry with a Golden Crown.

The food here was some of the best I’ve had in Sri Lanka! Cooked with love and attention to detail, the curry was absolutely delicious. Service was very professional, and the restaurant was clean and well managed. 

Aside from the food, the owner was also...extremely kind and friendly, happy to chat with a solo traveler like me! Definitely recomme extremely kind and friendly, happy to chat with a solo traveler like me! Definitely recommend!

We had the best meal we had in Negombo. We bot had the Sri Lankan curry which was cooked perfectly to our taste with a variety of accompaniments. Really tasty and nicely presented. All the food was great and the service perfect. The two guys...who own this restaurant and friendly and attentive, and both English speakers. Well worth a visit. Gay friend who own this restaurant and friendly and attentive, and both English speakers. Well worth a visit. Gay friendly.

We came across this delightful little restaurant in Negombo, Sri Lanka. We loved both the food and service and returned for more. We look forward to some more meals at Centella Bistro on our next visit to Sri Lanka.

Fantastic restaurant! We were drawn in by the cappuccino sign & stayed on for some lunch. The most delicious fish curry & pasta dishes! The owner is an animal rescue superstar & we loved meeting Skinny & hearing the story of such a beautiful dog,...who is now thankfully safe & much loved.
Lovely restaurant, great food & hospitality, can highly recomme who is now thankfully safe & much loved.
Lovely restaurant, great food & hospitality, can highly recommend!

What a great find! We had excellent service, the most delicious food and lovely company in this super restaurant. A little way out of central Negumbo but well worth  the walk. If you want top quality, authentic Sri Lankan food and great value for money...then this is the pl then this is the place
This restaurant/bistro offers great food for a good price. One of the best restaurants to be found in Negombo. Highly recommended.

Four of us ventured back to the Centello Bistro around 18 months since our last dinner there. Three of us ordered two starters each. One of our friends liked them very much but both my wife and I thought the deep fried dishes had been...deep fried for too lo deep fried for too long.

We ordered the fish curry and the chicken curry, both excellent. Large portions, arrive hungry. Excellent value for money. A starter to share, 2 smoothies, 2 mains and some water for less than 10 euro a person. Excellent chef, who also cares for some of...the local stray animals with money used from the resturaunt! Great g the local stray animals with money used from the resturaunt! Great guy!

Amazing staff and great quality food. We are animal lovers and love that they take in rescues. 
Highly recommend visiting for a meal whilst in Negombo.

We attended this bistro twice now and have found the staff to be welcoming, accommodating and very friendly. 

The food was very good, freshly cooked to order with excellent flavours, presentation and attention to detail with the pairings, tonight in particular the homemade passion fruit...cheesecake was a delight to end the night along with a good coffee (which we have found hard to come by in Negombo!)

Both owners Denis and Nalika are lovely, welcoming and friendly, they are very attentive hosts and cannot do more to welcome you into their bistro and share their knowledge of Sri Lanka to help you have a wonderful stay. 

If you are in the area and looking for fresh / tasty food then a visit to here is a must cheesecake was a delight to end the night along with a good coffee (which we have found hard to come by in Negombo!)

Both owners Denis and Nalika are lovely, welcoming and friendly, they are very attentive hosts and cannot do more to welcome you into their bistro and share their knowledge of Sri Lanka to help you have a wonderful stay. 

If you are in the area and looking for fresh / tasty food then a visit to here is a must :)
Such lovely staff and excellent food and great atmosphere. We highly recommend this restaurant. Meals were generous serving sizes and great prices.

OMG!! We'd planned to go to Edwin's, early dinner, then back to watch Netflix! Unfortunately,  Edwin's was closed! Next door, Queens Restaurant had a few tables in, so we popped in, just for a drink. We saw lovely looking food coming out, so we decided...to eat! I LOVE spicy food, I've struggled during my month in Sri Lanka, so I really laboured the importance for my Sri Lankan rice & prawn curry to be 'proper Sri Lankan Spicy! Egg & Cheese Kottu for hubby (medium spice!).
Super quick the food arrived. Piping hot, very, very tasty, not as spicy as I'd hoped but still delicious! Every bite from start to finish was delicious! 2 beers to drink! £15!!
100% recomme to eat! I LOVE spicy food, I've struggled during my month in Sri Lanka, so I really laboured the importance for my Sri Lankan rice & prawn curry to be 'proper Sri Lankan Spicy! Egg & Cheese Kottu for hubby (medium spice!).
Super quick the food arrived. Piping hot, very, very tasty, not as spicy as I'd hoped but still delicious! Every bite from start to finish was delicious! 2 beers to drink! £15!!
100% recommend.
Insane portions. My ordered chichen curry and rice i think 8 separate dishes arrived .....all lovely my chicken dish superb also. Beautiful food at knockdown prices.

Absolutey fantastic, that was our first rice and curry and after having eaten this vegetable rice and curry our standard is very high :) also the Biriyani was amazing. The restaurant is beatiful with a garden full of flowers and really nice staff.
The food in this quaint little restaurant is delicious.. Dinethra was our lovely server who was attentive.. The presentation of the food was lovely, portion were also good.
delicious food, nice staff who speak English, it was a hit👌 a clean space with many decorative accessories that give the place atmosphere and character

The owner of YENARA TOUR of Colombo , invited me and some friends to have lunch at The QUEEN Restaurant in Negombo . I wished to eat fish. 
I dare say that the lunch had been something special! 
Fresh fish, elegant place, lovely and gentle...people.
I do recomand  people.
I do recomand it!

I ordered a spicy Sri Lankan rice and curry, when it came it was huge with at least half a dozen different plates but alas not spicy. The staff went out of their way to get a spicy curry sauce from the kitchen to add...an extra plate! I have also had a chicken biryani here which was very, very goo an extra plate! I have also had a chicken biryani here which was very, very good !

We have visited this restaurant a couple of times for lunch and drinks. It’s a great relaxing vibe with good service and excellent food.
They also recommend an Ayurvedic spa who picked us up from there and dropped us back afterwards.
The treatments we had...were great too and reasonably priced.
Thank you Quee were great too and reasonably priced.
Thank you Queens!
Stunning,  lovely staff - Dinethra was a nice and professional, gorgeous breakfast.  Worth every penny to visit and try it. Nice vibe. Highly recommended .
Really delicious 👌 like in a garden but directly at the street. Very calm and you feel a little hided behind all the flowers. A Cosy, delicious and friendly place

We had this restaurant near our hotel. Food was amazing they had a good options to choose from. We ordered fish and curry. Quality was really good and it was really big portion of food. The price for our food was mind blowing for that...much food we had it was great price. I would totally recommend to visit this restaurant you will get a lot of food for great pri much food we had it was great price. I would totally recommend to visit this restaurant you will get a lot of food for great price.

Very good lunch and service.
Will recommend this place.
Were there for lunch in January 2023.
Regards
Jette og Dan
Denmark
Graet place to eat. We were in the area for a week and had dinner here a couple of times. Good food, reasonable prices.
The food here is really, really tasty. Every dish has lots of flavors, making it a nice place for people who love yummy and satisfying meals.

I had a set menu with a delicious chicken curry, rice, pineapple curry. Daal, coconut sambol and pappadom.

It was fresh and delicious. I’m very fussy about chicken but this was lean chicken breast, really lovely and the curry had coconut and spices. 

I’ll go...again while I’m in Nego again while I’m in Negombo

This is a very friendly family run restaurant. Among us we had seafood kotu and (very large) tuna steaks. The cocktail list was not extensive but came with a generous free pour of the spirit. The graffiti on the walls is a testament to the...number of international travelers that have already visited and am sure many more will come to enjoy a meal and drink he number of international travelers that have already visited and am sure many more will come to enjoy a meal and drink here.

Great find, picture menu outside but don't be put off! I had the set meal. You can choose a curry (i chose chicken), rice, dahl , pineapple and coconut dish , i asked for mild which was no problem as cooked to order, all for...just over £5.. the owner was very friendly and there were lots of regular customers being welcomed  just over £5.. the owner was very friendly and there were lots of regular customers being welcomed in.

We have just arrived in Negombo and Ammehula was our first proper meal out and it could hardly have gone better. We ordered a traditional Sri Lankan chicken curry which came with all the usual trimmings and devilled prawns with fried vegetable noodles. All the...food is cooked freshly to order so a small wait has to be expected but when the food arrived we were not disappointed. Tasty and spicy like we ordered.  Will definitely be ba food is cooked freshly to order so a small wait has to be expected but when the food arrived we were not disappointed. Tasty and spicy like we ordered.  Will definitely be back.
That restaurant is one of the best place for dinner. The food is the top of Negombo. The staff are veri kind and helpfull. We'll go back agan. I can recomend for everi one.¹
This place might not look like much, but the food was SO good. Do yourself a favour and order the traditional Sri Lankan set menu.
Ammehula is a small family restaurant in Negombo.They have exellent good food.The prices are ok.Have softdrinks,vine and beer.The owner Saman is a joke ful and nice man.
The best food quality in Negombo, would strongly recommend you give it a try, battered king prawns caught locally are a must. Very friendly service from what looked like a mother and daughter team.

The best food in the area. And the food is surprisingly affordable too compared to the other restaurants in the area. We went there once on the first day and then ended up going there five times for lunch within our 6-day trip to negombo....Highly recommend the following :
1. Traditional Sri lankan meal with chicken curry
2. Chips (french fries)
3. Chicken fried rice
4. Kottu

We also tried deviled chicken and prawn curry with rice. They were good too but the above four dishes were amazing. 

Posting the pictures for reference. Price is around 2100 Rupees for main course+ a dri Highly recommend the following :

Best rice & curry in Sri Lanka! We spent 3 weeks in the country and didn't find better. Staff is very kind, food is fresh and tasty.

From fresh prawns to special coffees and hookah at night, this place is nothing short of amazing. I stayed at Camelot Beach Hotel and found this gem just across the street. The service and food are amazing. It’s a great place for locals and tourists...ali alike.
A fantastic, authentic Sri Lankan restaurant with a friendly and helpful owner.  He shows a lot of pride in his food and gave a lot of helpful advice to help us on our trip

Called in for a late dinner after a long day trip. Hubby ordered Sri Lanka curry and I chose Chicken Noodles. Both dishes we're amazing, fresh, hot and plenty of it. Service was so friendly we'll deffinatley be going back. Thank you!

If you want a lovely experience at a very friendly local restaurant then this is definitely the place to visit. Gordon Ramsey would have no complaint's with the Chef here. The fresh juices omg, and when you go to some places the Beer is not...cold enough, not here though ice cold. TBH I was surprised how good this place is, no complaints from me and i have been to many Restaurants around the World.  Hope you have a great time , have fun in Negom cold enough, not here though ice cold. TBH I was surprised how good this place is, no complaints from me and i have been to many Restaurants around the World.  Hope you have a great time , have fun in Negombo.

Amazing food. We had the vegetarian curry, super tasty and good. Best curry I’ve had. The staff let us adjust it for our taste (spicy/not spicy etc). He also gave some great recommendations for our further travels.
So far this place is the best Italian restaurant with best quality ingredients thanks to their amazing chef and his food 😍

We chose to eat here as another Italian restaurant was too busy! The restaurant has a few tables eating, we were able to get a nice table at the front of the restaurant. 
Service was a little, I don't really know, not slow, not rude,...just functional! 
We shared a steak tartare,  good portion, needed some acidity like capers. Pasta and risotto were both very tasty but needed a little more heat. On the whole, a nice meal, I'd recommend, but with so many other places to try, I wouldn't go back on this trip.
A strange yet amusing thing, on the cocktail menu, there is one containing Baileys (an expensive ingredient in Sri Lanka), we asked if we could have the cocktail but without the  Baileys and how much would it be, the response? the same price!!! Ha! Ha! Everything is negotiable here, but obviously not the cocktail price her just functional! 
We shared a steak tartare,  good portion, needed some acidity like capers. Pasta and risotto were both very tasty but needed a little more heat. On the whole, a nice meal, I'd recommend, but with so many other places to try, I wouldn't go back on this trip.

Amazing food! Strongly recommend to visit. We ate pizza, risotto and gnocchi. Bravo. We will come back again. Thanks a lot

Delicious food, prices slightly more expensive but still cheap compared to Europe.
Fantastic service, cards payments accepted and cold beer!
Best ever experience . Food was Delicious, Service was The Best one, also food Quality and place was Perfect. Recommended

We were so excited to have dinner there, based on the reviews and photos.  We didn’t mind to pay the higher prices either.  What a disappointment!  Terrible service and “couldn’t care less” attitude.  Ordered a medium steak, got a tiny, very thin dry and tough...- well done steak.  What upset me the most was the fact that it was supposed to come with garlic bread.  They had the nerve to put a slice of old bread on the plate, not even toasted, no butter, no garlic.  This is what I meant by “couldn’t care less”.  The place was maybe 20% full.  No excuse for this what’s so ever.  White wine served in a basic water glass.  I feel bad for the owner who probably worked hard to establish the place, just to be ruined by the careless sta - well done steak. we wanted to have a nice lunch and came across this beautiful restaurant.  We also had a delicious meal there.  the service was super friendly and the sri lanka pizza with garlic and peppers was really delicious.  the pasta was also delicious.

A little Italy in Negombo - Sri Lanka  I have seen.Just walked to enjoy my dinner with Spaghetti. Ordered a Cheese with Chicken Spaghetti & Mojito from beverage menu, no words to explain I've really enjoyed with my meal. Finally ordered one more Garlic and...Spicy Pepper Spaghetti It was also good. 
Friendly staff, Specially Tishan given an excellent service. Thank you Tishan.
I'll come back with my family as soon as possible.

Thanks all again  Spicy Pepper Spaghetti It was also good.

Thanks all again !!!

Worst experience I ever had in a restaurant!! The dishes are not 1% like the pictures in the menu, shame that they called themselves a restaurant.
Literally got scammed!!!
exselent restorante, modern interior, pizzas the best. Servis very goof. A lot of vine species. It vas good tume wiyh family.
Very tasty and authentic italian food in the middle of Negombo. Service is awesome and the food is preciously done. Burrata, pizza, pasta, everything here tastes like made in Italy itself.
Great service, great food and amazing to have such a good Italian kitchen here in Sri Lankan. It was unexpected to find one here

Outstanding Italian restaurant in negombo! Incredible ingredients, perfect cherry tomatoes with perfect burrata and appetising garlic and rosemary bread starter. Awesome pizza from wood oven. Highly recommended

We went there because our kids asked for pizza & pasta. We did not expect a lot when going there and we came back the day after again - it is a nice restaurant and the pizza is amazing. Writing this as a European citizen...who knows the Italian cuisine quite well, we were impressed about the crusty and very tasty pizza. Also the pasta was al dente and very delicious. We learned afterwards that the owner lived in Italy and was obviously exposed to traditional Italian meals. We found the price (25-30€) for 3 main courses & 4 soft drinks still reasonab who knows the Italian cuisine quite well, we were impressed about the crusty and very tasty pizza. We found the price (25-30€) for 3 main courses & 4 soft drinks still reasonable.

Excellent food 
Prawn ravioli and pizza
Beer and wine
Great service by Sheehan
Great taste 
Great presentation

We went with family and friends and was given an excellent service and the food was delicious and made of the best groceries. We order homedelivery a few days later and it tasted as good as first time and superb service.

If you eat anywhere in Negombo make this place your choice… 
The fresh red snapper fillet with sauce was out of this world!

We were visiting friends in Negombo and on the spur of the moment decided to drop in at PREGO for lunch.  We were delighted beyond expectations with the vegetarian bruschetta and pizza.  Tasted  just perfect. Steward Indika’s service was superb.

We're in Negombo for a week, we've visited Prego 2 days in a row, and I'm  certain we'll be back before we leave!! Our 1st visit was just for a drink. We'd passed during the day and chatted to a waiter, we liked the look...of the restaurant, menu, and drinks/wine choices, so we went back that night. A couple of drinks and a bruschetta, which was truly delicious!! The service was attentive and nice.The next night, we went back for a proper evening. I was really hungry! I had a starter portion of Pasta Carbonarra. It was big and so very tasty, I'd ordered steak for my main which again was tasty, cooked rare, it did have some grissel through half of it, but didn't impact on the taste. Hubby had tuna tartare, which was excellent and big, followed by seabass. It was also nice, but the veggies it came with made the dish a little too oily. Apple pie for pudding was lovely! We enjoyed a nice bottle of wine, which was from the wine store at the back. 
On this occasion, service, although pleasant, wasn't as efficient. The owner(?) was always around, but some of the servers seemed a little distracted. 
I'm certain we will be back for a 3rd visit before we leave! The restaurant is lovely, it's busy, buzzy and definitely one of our favourite of the restaurant, menu, and drinks/wine choices, so we went back that night. We enjoyed a nice bottle of wine, which was from the wine store at the back. 
On this occasion, service, although pleasant, wasn't as efficient. The owner(?) was always around, but some of the servers seemed a little distracted. 
I'm certain we will be back for a 3rd visit before we leave! The restaurant is lovely, it's busy, buzzy and definitely one of our favourites!!

I would say “Prego” is the one of the best Italian restaurants that there is in Sri Lanka. The quality and presentation of the dishes are what keeps us coming back. It’s all worth the money you spend. The prices are quite reasonable for what...you’ve been served. It’s a great place to go with family. The atmosphere and the service is great. I would highly recommend to try their seafood pizzas and pastas which is to die for. I always enjoy coming there, because they never disappoint yo you’ve been served. It’s a great place to go with family. The atmosphere and the service is great. I would highly recommend to try their seafood pizzas and pastas which is to die for. I always enjoy coming there, because they never disappoint you.👑

Good Italian restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.  It was quite hot indoors but they have a wine room where the wine is kept cool.  Unlike in other restaurants, it was therefore possible to get a decent bottle.  The food is good, it is lively...and the staff are friend and the staff are friendly.

Around 20 of us - the Tinkers group in Negombo, enjoyed dinner at Prego.  I ordered the Italian pork, with mushrooms, olives and an Italian cheese, which was quite good. There were obviously many more tourists in Negombo and, at one point, Prego was very...nearly full, which was a sight going back to pre covid da nearly full, which was a sight going back to pre covid days.
Excellent food at a very good price. I had the red snapper fillet and was the best fish I’ve had in Sri Lanka. Highly recommend.

The best restaurant we ate at during our 16-day trip to Sri Lanka. We didn't have a reservation, it was packed, but they still served us and even apologized because we had to wait a little longer (approx. 30 minutes). Not to mention the food,...it was absolutely fantastic. I highly, highly recommend  it was absolutely fantastic. I highly, highly recommend it!

We found this spot by complete accident. But wow! The food was immense and with a very good wine selection. We ate shellfish and pasta dishes. All were superb but the pasta was as good as I’ve ever eaten outside Italy. And the staff were...friendly and efficient without being overly attentive. And all excellent value for money. Thank you for a most enjoyable evening. We will be ba friendly and efficient without being overly attentive. And all excellent value for money. Thank you for a most enjoyable evening. We will be back!
We had a fantastic meal at Prego - lovely atmosphere and superbly fresh seafood. We can’t recommend it highly enough. Service was excellent and prices very good.

This is the place to go, if you want to have fresh and authentic Italian Food in combination with perfect service and good prices. We have been here many times in the last years and always left happy and satisfied. 
My wife is half Italian...and she said, the Pizza tasted like one, her mother prepared. What could be a better compliment and she said, the Pizza tasted like one, her mother prepared. What could be a better compliment ♥️

Visited continuously for 02 days to enjoy my dinner at Prego Italian Restaurant Negombo. Incharge or Manager who works there (Bald man I don't know his name 😁) he is very kind of us (for every guest who comes to Prego). He nicely talks to...guests & takes feedback from guests. Excellent guy who works there.
Anyway, I consumed 02 shots of Old Arrack on my 01st day and had a Cheesy Pizza and a nice dessert. The person I mentioned above really helped me to choose a good pizza & a good drink.
On the 02nd day, I consumed long island shots and a Carbonara (Spaghetti) & Apple cake for my dessert.. Actually I mentioned those things to recommend this place to everyone.
No words to explain their customer service also. Really attentive to guests and good disciplines and also they always provide good and delicious food & beverage.
Thank you guys..
Come back again to Preg guests & takes feedback from guests. Excellent guy who works there.

Really good food and great great coffee 😊 We tried their tuna tartare & one of the ravioli - make sure to get some of their pasta with tomato sauce! Their margarita pizza is one of the best we ever tried. And the staff is...so kind and frien so kind and friendly

We stayed at Heritance so this is just across the road. Comes alive at night. Walking thru into the interior you realise someone has made a real investment here, it was a cut above the other restaurants we visited. We were in Sri Lanka for...three weeks so I was used to local restaurants by now. Prego was the best we found in our travels. We shared a mixed bruschetta then I had a fillet steak with potatoes and my wife had prawn pasta. We both thought the food was excellent. With a couple of glasses of red and a virgin mojito bill came to £32. While we ate a couple of guys came in carrying a bucket full of fish, catch of the day just off the boat. Doesn’t come any fresh three weeks so I was used to local restaurants by now. Prego was the best we found in our travels. We shared a mixed bruschetta then I had a fillet steak with potatoes and my wife had prawn pasta. We both thought the food was excellent. With a couple of glasses of red and a virgin mojito bill came to £32. While we ate a couple of guys came in carrying a bucket full of fish, catch of the day just off the boat. Doesn’t come any fresher.

We had a lovely time at zen cafe! Delicious food, chill vibes, lovely atmosphere… our waiter ( mister no hair man) was on top of everything so we were constantly given a very good service 🥰 there were some lovely rescue cats and rescue dogs...that are being taken care of by the owner of the restaurant and the staf that are being taken care of by the owner of the restaurant and the staff 🤩

Excellent all day breakfast (avocado toast, cappuccino w coconut milk and fresh smoothie). Service was really friendly and the cafe was lovely, very cozy. 

They also look after rescued stray cats and neuter them which I really appreciate.
It's a beautiful place near the beach. They also have amazing food for a good price. I really loved breakfasts over here. Last but not least they have great staff who'll serve your food with a smile!

Delicious food, friendly prompt service.  Beautiful natural environment, lovely leafy courtyard area. Amazing coffee.
Being Australian I was really craving decent coffee, this cafe had the best coffee that we had during our 3 week holiday.
The food was tasty, healthy and beautifully presented, definitely...the best breakfast throughout our stay.
The owner was extremely hospitable and his cafe is definitely what I would call,  a must visit in Negom the best breakfast throughout our stay.
The owner was extremely hospitable and his cafe is definitely what I would call,  a must visit in Negombo.
Great food and great service. This charming cafe in Negombo made one feel truly welcome amongst the trickling water into ponds which resulted in a calm and tranquil haven
Yummy food, comfortable location, fast and friendly service, vegetarian menu. If you are lucky you may enjoy the company of a well-mannered zen cat :)
This is what a well ran establishment looks like.  Cosy atmosphere, top quality product!  Well done! Coffee better than in Italy ( anytime).  Desserts are top notch!
Horrible to see how the (male) owner  treats his employees. The food was nice. No coffee available! Wouldn’t go back again.More
Absolutely LOVE Zen Cafe! Always such a lovely welcome from Udaya and the food is amazing! Great smoothie bowls, great coffee & great carrot cake!

Very good food. The falafel wrap was definitely one of the better vegetarian foods I've eaten 👌🏼 The coffee taste wasn't the best I've tasted but still good and the cookies wasn't that special. Delicious ice tea though 😍🌺
My favourite place in Negombo. The owner and the staff are super helpful and kind. Their gluten-free/vegan pancakes are the best thing in the world. I can’t wait to come back here again!
Loved Cafe Zen for breakfast. Really friendly staff, food was great with big portions and nice coffee too. Will definitely revisit!

Wonderful cafe in Negombo. An amazing tranquil garden place admits all the chaos in the city. We went there every day for three days to eat breakfast or lunch because everyone in the family loved the fresh food and the friendly staff so much. Highly...recommend going the recommend going there!

I recently had breakfast at Cafe Zen. You definitely need to visit if you have not tried already. It is a small boutique restaurant that has a great vibe. All of the food is prepared and cooked to order. I had the granola bowl which...was fantastic. It is made up of homemade granola, curd and mounds of fresh local fruit served with a smile. The staff and service is excellent. They also serve a very good range of cold and hot drinks.
Well done everyo was fantastic. It is made up of homemade granola, curd and mounds of fresh local fruit served with a smile. The staff and service is excellent. They also serve a very good range of cold and hot drinks.
Well done everyone.

Definitely my favorite place in Negombo, Udaya and all team are great hosts, they made me feel very welcome and comfortable.
The food is just amazing, healthy, fresh and delicious, I warmly recommend it
